text: Hayward Keniston (July 5, 1883 – August 10, 1970) was a linguist who served as president of the Linguistic Society of America in 1948 and as dean of the University of Michigan College of Literature, Science and the Arts from 1945 to 1951. He received his PhD from Harvard University. His work focused predominantly on Spanish syntax and 16th century Spanish history. == References == * * Category:1883 births Category:1970 deaths Category:University of Michigan faculty Category:Harvard University alumni Category:Linguists of Spanish Category:Linguists from the United States Category:Linguistic Society of America presidents Category:20th-century linguists
title: Hayward Keniston
